title: HTTP node/health error
body:
### Describe the bug

The HTTP RPC `eth/v1/node/health` endpoint crashes.

```bash
> curl localhost:3500/eth/v1/node/health
{"message":"connection error: desc = \"transport: authentication handshake failed: tls: failed to verify certificate: x509: cannot validate certificate for 0.0.0.0 because it doesn't contain any IP SANs\"","code":503}
```

At  the same time, the syncing endpoint works just fine
```bash
> curl localhost:3500/eth/v1/node/syncing
{"data":{"head_slot":"7616690","sync_distance":"1","is_syncing":false,"is_optimistic":false,"el_offline":false}}
```

### Has this worked before in a previous version?

```text
The new HTTP endpoint was just introduced in the previous version.
```


### ðŸ”¬ Minimal Reproduction

```bash

{"message":"connection error: desc = \"transport: authentication handshake failed: tls: failed to verify certificate: x509: cannot validate certificate for 0.0.0.0 because it doesn't contain any IP SANs\"","code":503}
```

### Error

```text
transport: authentication handshake failed: tls: failed to verify certificate: x509: cannot validate certificate for 0.0.0.0 because it doesn't contain any IP SANs
```


### Platform(s)

Linux (x86)

### What version of Prysm are you running? (Which release)

v4.1.1

### Anything else relevant (validator index / public key)?

The beacon node has a TLS certificate configured through `--tls-cert`, `--tls-key`
